# Data Analysis Techniques

## Project Overview
This repository demonstrates core data analysis techniques commonly used in real-world analytics workflows.
Each notebook focuses on a specific analytical concept, using practical datasets to illustrate data preparation, transformation, and analysis.

The project is designed to showcase proficiency in handling structured data using Python and Pandas.

---

## Project Structure

data-analysis-techniques/
│
├── datasets/
│ └── Datasets used across notebooks
│
├── 01_data_cleaning.ipynb
├── 02_data_merging.ipynb
├── 03_pivot_tables.ipynb
├── 04_time_series_analysis.ipynb
│
└── README.md

---

## Covered Techniques

### Data Cleaning
- Handling missing values
- Fixing data types and formats
- Cleaning inconsistent or invalid entries

### Data Merging
- Combining datasets using joins and concatenation
- Understanding different merge strategies
- Resolving key mismatches

### Pivot Tables & Aggregation
- Summarizing data using pivot tables
- Grouping and aggregating key metrics
- Extracting insights from structured summaries

### Time Series Analysis
- Working with datetime data
- Resampling and trend analysis
- Exploring temporal patterns in data

---

## Tools & Libraries
- Python
- Pandas
- NumPy
- Matplotlib
- Jupyter Notebook

---

## Key Takeaways
- Structured data preparation is essential for reliable analysis
- Merging and aggregation enable multi-dimensional insights
- Time-based analysis reveals trends not visible in static data

---

## Potential Extensions
- Apply techniques to larger real-world datasets
- Integrate visual dashboards
- Extend time series analysis with forecasting models
